Complains/Symptoms.name: Swelling over the face and abdomen
Swelling over the face and abdomen

Diagnosis.name: IFRNS (Infrequently relapsing nephrotic syndrome) in clinical remission
IFRNS (Infrequently relapsing nephrotic syndrome) in clinical remission

Complains/Symptoms.name: No history of poor or thin stream of urine

Diagnosis.name: High dose steroid dependent nephrotic syndrome
High dose steroid dependent nephrotic syndrome
High dose steroid dependent nephrotic syndrome

Complains/Symptoms.name: No history of dysuria or hematuria

General Advice.name:
Avoid vaccination until the child is off steroid for a month.
In case of emergency, one can give a killed vaccine.

No added salt diet and avoid high salt diet like papad, pickle, wafers, kurkure, biscuits, packed and preservative products, etc. 
One can add low to medium salt for a routine diet like dal, sabzi.
One can eat an egg however avoid the yellow part only give the white part.   
Avoid deeply fried items like samosa, kachori.
Give normal protein in the diet, no need to give extra protein or protein-restricted diet.
When there is no swelling and the child is not on steroid one can take a normal diet

Diagnosis.name: High dose steroid dependent nephrotic syndrome

Complains/Symptoms.name: Swelling over the face and abdomen
No history of dysuria or hematuria
No history of similar complaint in the past or family

General Advice.name: Avoid nephrotoxic medications for eg. give only paracetamol at time of fever and avoid ibuprofen, mafenamic acid
